Key Match Events: The Cavaliers won a critical challenge with 1:19 remaining to retain possession leading by three.
Cleveland's role players made 10 out of 15 corner 3-point attempts.
Darius Garland recorded 18 points and seven assists.
Evan Mobley recorded 21 points, 10 rebounds, and seven assists.
Jarrett Allen recorded 25 points, 11 rebounds, and six assists.
Cleveland pulled in four critical offensive rebounds in an 18-second span between the 1:37 and 1:19 marks.
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder's 15-game winning streak was snapped.
The Cavaliers moved to an NBA-best 32-4 on the season.
The Thunder's defense allows a high number of corner 3-point attempts, which was exploited by Cleveland.
Others: Chet Holmgren, the Defensive Player of the Year frontrunner, was noted as a missing factor for the Thunder due to his hip injury.
The Thunder should consider adding a creator at the trade deadline to improve their offense.
